figures.description: Two perpendicular vectors of magnitudes 6.0 N (vertical) and 8.0 N (horizontal). Used in Question 5.
Three cone positions labeled X, Y, Z (on base, on tip, on side). Used to identify neutral equilibrium (Question 8).
Circuit diagram: three resistors 2Ω, 4Ω, 12Ω connected in parallel across a 12 V battery. Used in Question 34.

questions.question: Which Question Paper Type of Physics is given to you?
questions.explanation: The page header clearly shows "PAPER TYPE: C".

questions.question: A carpenter on top of a roof 20.0 m high dropped a hammer of mass 1.5 kg and it fell freely to the ground. The kinetic energy of the hammer just before hitting the ground is ...... [\(g = 10\,\text{m s}^{-2}\)]
questions.explanation: Loss of potential energy becomes kinetic energy: \(KE = mgh = 1.5\times 10\times 20 = 300\,J\). This corresponds to option D, not A.

questions.question: Two balls X and Y weighing 5 g and 50 kg respectively were thrown up vertically at the same time with a velocity of 100 m s\(^{-1}\). How will their positions be one second later?

options.text: X and Y will both be 500 m from the point of throw
X and Y will be 500 m from each other
Y will be 500 m ahead of X
X will be 500 m ahead of Y

questions.explanation: From the image, all options mention 500 m, but with initial speed 100 m/s and \(g=10\,\text{m s}^{-2}\), displacement after 1 s is \(s = ut - \tfrac{1}{2}gt^2 = 100(1) - 5(1)^2 = 95\,m\). Both masses have the same motion (ignoring air resistance), so they are at the same position 95 m from the point of throw. None of the listed 500 m options matches this, indicating a mismatch/printing issue in the question/options as shown.

questions.question: A man standing on a lift that is descending does not feel any weight because

options.text: there is no gravitational pull on the man in the lift
the inside of the lift is air tight
there is no reaction from the floor of the lift

questions.explanation: In free fall (or if descending with acceleration \(g\)), the normal reaction becomes zero, so apparent weight is zero.

questions.question: The diagram above shows two vectors at right angles to each other. The value of the resultant vector is
An object of mass 2 kg moves with a velocity of 10 m s\(^{-1}\) round a circle of radius 4 m. Calculate the centripetal force on the object.
questions.explanation: Centripetal force \(F=\frac{mv^2}{r}=\frac{2\times 10^2}{4}=\frac{200}{4}=50\,N\). This is option D, not C.

questions.question: If it takes an object 3 s to fall freely to the ground from a certain height, what is the distance covered by the object? [\(g = 10\,\text{m s}^{-2}\)]
questions.explanation: For free fall from rest: \(s=\tfrac{1}{2}gt^2=\tfrac{1}{2}\times 10\times 3^2=5\times 9=45\,m\). This is option D, not B.

questions.question: The diagrams above show the positions of a cone. The position which can be described as neutral equilibrium is represented as
questions.explanation: Neutral equilibrium occurs when small displacement does not raise or lower the centre of gravity (the cone on its side). That is position Z.

questions.question: If a tube of small radius opened at both ends is placed in a liquid, the liquid will

options.text: rise above the liquid level if the liquid does not wet the glass
remain at the same level irrespective of whether the liquid wets the glass or not
fall below the liquid level if the liquid wets the glass
fall below the liquid level if the liquid does not wet the glass

questions.explanation: If the liquid does not wet the glass (e.g., mercury), capillary depression occurs: level in the tube falls below the outside level.

questions.question:
I. Density of the liquid
II. Depth below the surface of the liquid.
III. Surface area of the liquid
In which of the statement above will pressure be dependent?
questions.explanation: Hydrostatic pressure \(p = \rho g h\) depends on density \(\rho\) and depth \(h\), not surface area.

questions.question:
I. High thermal capacity
II. High sensitivity
III. Easy readability
IV. Accuracy over a wide range of temperatures
From the statements above, the qualities of a good thermometer are
questions.explanation: A good thermometer should be sensitive, easy to read, and accurate over a wide range. High thermal capacity is undesirable because it reduces responsiveness.

questions.question: A machine is used to lift a load of 20 N through a height of 10 m. If the efficiency of the machine is 40%, how much work is done?
questions.explanation: Useful work output = \(L\times h = 20\times 10=200\,J\). Efficiency \(\eta=\frac{\text{output}}{\text{input}}\Rightarrow \text{input}=\frac{200}{0.40}=500\,J\). The work done by the machine (input work) is 500 J (option C), not D.

questions.question: Which of the following could be effectively used to reduce friction?
questions.explanation: Grease acts as a lubricant, reducing friction between surfaces.

questions.question: A copper wire was subjected to a tensile stress of \(7.7\times 10^7\,\text{N m}^{-2}\). Calculate the tensile strain of the wire. [Young modulus = \(1.1\times 10^{11}\,\text{N m}^{-2}\)]
questions.explanation: Strain \(=\frac{\text{stress}}{Y}=\frac{7.7\times 10^7}{1.1\times 10^{11}}=7.0\times 10^{-4}\) (approx).

questions.question: An object weighs 22 kg in water 30 kg in air. What is the up thrust exerted by the liquid on the object? [\(g=10\,\text{m s}^{-2}\)]
questions.explanation: Upthrust = loss of weight in water = \((30-22)g = 8\times 10 = 80\,N\).

questions.question: A block of aluminium is heated electrically by a 30 W heater. If the temperature rises by 100°C in 5 minutes, the heat capacity of the aluminium is
questions.explanation: Energy supplied \(Q = Pt = 30\times (5\times 60)=30\times 300=9000\,J\). Heat capacity \(C=\frac{Q}{\Delta T}=\frac{9000}{100}=90\,J K^{-1}\). This is option C, not A.

questions.question: A perfect emitter or absorber of radiant energy is a
questions.explanation: A black body is an ideal absorber and emitter of radiation.

questions.question: The phenomenon that shows that increase in pressure lowers the melting point can be observed in
questions.explanation: Regelation demonstrates melting under pressure and refreezing when pressure is removed (ice).

questions.question: If the volume of a gas increases steadily as the temperature decreases at constant pressure, the gas obeys
questions.explanation: At constant pressure, volume varies directly with absolute temperature (Charles’ law).

questions.question: Steam burn is more severe than that of boiling water because

options.text: steam burn is dependent on relative humidity
steam burn is independent of relative humidity
steam possesses greater heat energy per unit mass
water boils at a higher temperature

questions.explanation: Steam releases latent heat of condensation in addition to sensible heat, delivering more energy per unit mass.

questions.question: Which of the following types of waves needs a medium for propagation?
questions.explanation: Sound is a mechanical wave and requires a material medium.

questions.question: The ground is always cold at night because the

options.text: atmosphere reflects the sun’s energy at night
atmosphere absorbs the sun’s energy at night
earth radiates heat to the atmosphere at night
sun no longer shines at night

questions.explanation: At night the ground loses heat mainly by radiation to the surroundings/sky, cooling down.

questions.question: A metal of volume 40 cm\(^3\) is heated from 30°C to 90°C, the increase in volume is .... [Linear expansivity of the metal = \(2.0\times 10^{-5}\,K^{-1}\)]
questions.explanation: Volume expansivity \(\beta\approx 3\alpha = 6.0\times 10^{-5}\,K^{-1}\). \(\Delta T=60\,K\). \(\Delta V=\beta V\Delta T = (6.0\times 10^{-5})(40)(60)=0.144\,\text{cm}^3\). This matches option B, not C.

questions.question:
I. Change of state
II. Diffusion
III. Radiation
IV. Osmosis
Which of the processes above can be explained using the kinetic theory?
questions.explanation: Kinetic theory explains particle motion effects such as change of state, diffusion, and osmosis; radiation is electromagnetic and not explained by kinetic theory of matter.

questions.question: When the human eye loses its power of accommodation, the defect is known as
questions.explanation: Presbyopia is age-related loss of accommodation.

questions.question: A length of wire has a frequency of 255 Hz when stretched by a force of 225 N. If the force increases to 324 N, what is the new frequency of vibration?
questions.explanation: For a stretched string, \(f\propto \sqrt{T}\). \(f_2=f_1\sqrt{\frac{T_2}{T_1}}=255\sqrt{\frac{324}{225}}=255\sqrt{1.44}=255\times 1.2=306\,Hz\).

questions.question: A certain far-sighted person cannot see objects that are closer to the eye than 50 cm clearly. Determine the power of the converging lens which will enable him to see at 25 cm.
questions.explanation: Lens should form a virtual image at the near point (50 cm) of an object at 25 cm. Using sign convention: \(u=-25\,cm\), \(v=-50\,cm\). \(\frac{1}{f}=\frac{1}{v}-\frac{1}{u}=\left(-\frac{1}{50}\right)-\left(-\frac{1}{25}\right)=\frac{1}{50}\). So \(f=50\,cm=0.5\,m\), power \(P=\frac{1}{f}=2.0\,D\). This is not among options, indicating the options’ scale is inconsistent with the standard calculation.

questions.question: Which of the following electromagnetic waves has the highest frequency?
questions.explanation: Among the listed, X-rays have the highest frequency.

questions.question: When a red rose flower is observed in blue light, what colour does the observer see?
questions.explanation: A red object reflects red light and absorbs other colours. Under blue illumination, there is essentially no red light to reflect, so it appears black/dark. 'Black' is not among the options shown, so the correct choice cannot be selected from the provided options.

questions.question: The eclipse of the sun occurs when the

options.text: moon’s umbra falls on some part of the earth
moon is between the sun and the earth
earth is between the sun and the moon
moon is not completely hidden in the earth’s shadow

questions.explanation: A solar eclipse occurs when the Moon lies between the Earth and the Sun (so the Moon’s shadow falls on Earth).

questions.question: A cannon is fired from town X. After how long is the sound heard at a town Y 4.95 km away? [velocity of sound in air = 333 m s\(^{-1}\)]
questions.explanation: Distance \(=4.95\,km=4950\,m\). Time \(t=\frac{d}{v}=\frac{4950}{333}\approx 14.9\,s\). This matches option A (15 s), not D.

questions.question: An image in a convex lens is upright magnified 3 times. If the focal length of the lens is 15 cm, what is the object distance?
questions.explanation: Upright magnified implies virtual image: magnification \(m=+3\) and \(m=\frac{v}{u}\Rightarrow v=3u\) (both negative). Lens formula: \(\frac{1}{f}=\frac{1}{v}-\frac{1}{u}\). Substitute \(v=3u\): \(\frac{1}{f}=\frac{1}{3u}-\frac{1}{u}=-\frac{2}{3u}\). With \(f=+15\,cm\): \(\frac{1}{15}=-\frac{2}{3u}\Rightarrow u=-10\,cm\). Object distance magnitude = 10 cm (option B).

questions.question: The capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor is 20 μF in air and 60 μF in the presence of a dielectric. What is the dielectric constant?
questions.explanation: Dielectric constant \(k=\frac{C_{dielectric}}{C_{air}}=\frac{60}{20}=3\).

questions.question: In the circuit below, three resistors 2 Ω, 4 Ω and 12 Ω are connected in parallel and a 12 V battery is connected across the combination. The current flowing through the 12 Ω resistor is
questions.explanation: In parallel, each resistor has 12 V across it. Current through 12 Ω: \(I=\frac{V}{R}=\frac{12}{12}=1.0\,A\).

questions.question: If the charge of electricity per kWh is N4, what is the cost of operating an electrical appliance rated 2.50 V, 2 A for 6 hours?
questions.explanation: Power \(P=VI=2.5\times 2=5\,W=0.005\,kW\). Energy in 6 h: \(E=0.005\times 6=0.03\,kWh\). Cost: \(0.03\times 4=0.12\) Naira.

questions.question: The correct expression for the potential at a point, distance r from a charge q, in an electric field is
questions.explanation: Electric potential due to a point charge: \(V=\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{q}{r}\).

questions.question: Three similar cells each of e.m.f 2 V and internal resistance 2 Ω are connected in parallel, the total e.m.f and total internal resistance are respectively
questions.explanation: For identical cells in parallel, emf remains 2 V. Equivalent internal resistance \(r_{eq}=\frac{r}{n}=\frac{2}{3}=0.67\,\Omega\approx 0.7\,\Omega\).

questions.question: In homes, electrical appliances and lamps are connected in parallel because

options.text: parallel connection does not heat up the wires

questions.explanation: Domestic wiring is in parallel so each appliance receives the full mains voltage and can operate independently. None of the listed options states this, so the correct choice cannot be selected from the provided options.

questions.question: Two resistors 5 Ω and 10 Ω are arranged first in series and later in parallel to a 24 V source. The ratio of total power dissipated in the series and parallel arrangement respectively is
questions.explanation: Series: \(R_s=5+10=15\,\Omega\). \(P_s=\frac{V^2}{R_s}=\frac{24^2}{15}=\frac{576}{15}=38.4\,W\). Parallel: \(R_p=\frac{5\times 10}{5+10}=\frac{50}{15}=3.33\,\Omega\). \(P_p=\frac{576}{3.33}=172.8\,W\). Ratio \(P_s:P_p=38.4:172.8=1:4.5\approx 2:9\). This does not match any option; if computed exactly: \(38.4:172.8=4:18=2:9\), none listed.

questions.question: Which of the following will be applied when a metal X is purified by electrolysis?

options.text: Y is the anode and very high current is used
X is the anode and very high current is used
X is the cathode and Y is the anode
Y is the cathode and X is the anode

questions.explanation: In electrolytic refining, the impure metal is the anode and pure metal is deposited on the cathode. So X (metal to be purified) is anode, and Y is cathode.

questions.question: A radioactive isotope has a decay constant of \(10^{-5}\,\text{s}^{-1}\). Calculate its half-life.
Which of the following is a property of steel?

options.text: It can easily be magnetized and demagnetized
It cannot retain its magnetism longer than iron
It can be used for making temporary magnets
It can be used for making permanent magnets

questions.explanation: Steel has higher retentivity than soft iron and is used for permanent magnets.

questions.question: If the threshold frequency for tungsten is \(1.3\times 10^{15}\,Hz\), what is its work function? [\(h = 6.6\times 10^{-34}\,J\,s\)]
In an a.c. circuit, the ratio of r.m.s value to peak value of current is
questions.explanation: For a sinusoidal current, \(I_{rms}=\frac{I_0}{\sqrt{2}}\), so \(\frac{I_{rms}}{I_0}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\).

questions.question: Two inductors of inductances 4 H and 8 H are arranged in series and a current of 10 A is passed through them. What is the energy stored in them?
questions.explanation: Series inductance: \(L=4+8=12\,H\). Energy \(U=\tfrac{1}{2}LI^2=\tfrac{1}{2}(12)(10^2)=6\times 100=600\,J\). Not in options; closest is 500 J (B), but exact is 600 J from the given data.

questions.question: Under which of the following conditions do gasses conduct electricity?
questions.explanation: Gases conduct electricity when ionized, typically at low pressure with sufficiently high potential difference.

questions.question: In measuring high frequency a.c., the instrument used is the
questions.explanation: Hot-wire ammeters respond to heating effect and can measure high-frequency a.c.

questions.question: The bond between silicon and germanium is
questions.explanation: Si and Ge are Group 14 elements and bond predominantly by sharing electrons (covalent bonding).

questions.question: Which of the following materials has an increase in resistance with temperature?
questions.explanation: Metals generally have a positive temperature coefficient of resistance; resistance increases with temperature.

questions.question: The electrical properties of germination can be altered drastically by the addition of
questions.explanation: Semiconductor electrical properties are altered by adding impurities (doping).
